      | Clover Field | Sweet clover, grass, meadow | Country walk |

      | Citrus Zest | Lemon zest, lime zest, bright | Cooking memory |

      ATMOSPHERIC & AMBIENT (10 Accords)

      | Accord Name | Character | Example Memory |

      |-------------|-----------|----------------|

      | Golden Hour | Warm amber, glowing, solar | Sunset magic |

      | Cold Mountain Air | Crisp ozone, altitude, clean | Mountain summit |

      | Summer Heat | Dry warmth, sun-baked, radiating | Desert afternoon |

      | Snowy Morning | Cold, clean, white musk | Winter landscape |

      | Twilight Garden | Dusk, cool, floral traces | Evening stroll |

      | Morning Light | Fresh, bright, airy | Sunrise awakening |

      | Thunderstorm | Ozone, electricity, wet | Storm watching |

      | Autumn Breeze | Crisp air, leaves, coolness | Fall day |

      | Night Blooming | Dark, mysterious, moonlit | Evening garden |

      | Spring Rain | Fresh rain, green, renewal | April shower |

      WARM & COMFORTING (9 Accords)

      | Accord Name | Character | Example Memory |

      |-------------|-----------|----------------|

      | Cozy Blanket | Clean cotton, soft, warm | Comfort memory |

      | Fireplace | Wood fire, smoke, hearth | Cabin evening |

      | Candle Wax | Beeswax, wick, burning | Ritual lighting |

      | Warm Skin | Musk, skin-like, intimate | Embrace memory |

      | Baby Powder | Soft powder, clean, innocent | Childhood |

      | Fresh Laundry | Clean cotton, soap, sunshine | Washing day |

      | Cashmere Sweater | Soft wool, comforting, cozy | Winter wardrobe |

      | Leather Jacket | Worn leather, soft, personal | Favorite jacket |

      | Old Books | Paper, dust, aged wood | Library memory |

      Combining Accords: Examples

      Example 1: "Maui Honeymoon Beach"
      • Tropical Water (25%) + Tropical Lei (20%) + Driftwood Beach (15%)
      • + Golden Hour (15%) + Coconut Cream (10%) + Warm Skin (10%)
      • + Ocean Breeze (5%)

      = Tropical romantic aquatic with warm woody base

      Example 2: "Grandmother's Garden, Childhood"
      • English Garden (30%) + Fresh-Cut Grass (20%) + Wet Soil (15%)
      • + Fresh Baked Bread (10%) + Twilight Garden (10%) + Old Books (10%)
      • + Lavender Field (5%)

      = Nostalgic floral-herbal with comforting gourmand undertones

      Example 3: "Paris Proposal in the Rain"
      • Spring Rain (20%) + Orange Blossom (15%) + French Perfumery (15%)
      • + Petrichor (15%) + Champagne (custom accord, 10%) + Cobblestone (mineral accord, 10%)
      • + Romantic Atmosphere (custom, 15%)

      = Fresh floral-aquatic with romantic Parisian character

      5. VISUAL IDENTITY

      Brand Name & Typography

      Primary Name: MEMOIR
      • Clean, uppercase, sans-serif (Futura or similar)
      • Timeless, modern, legible
      • Tagline beneath: "by L'Or√©al Luxe" (smaller, lighter weight)
      Secondary Name (International Markets):
      • M√âMOIRE (French) - maintains heritage
      • MEMORIA (Spanish/Italian) - expands reach
      Typography System:
      • Headlines: Futura Bold (modern, strong)
      • Body: Avenir (elegant, readable)
      • Accent: Optima (classic luxury touch for perfumer signatures)

      Color Palette

      Primary Colors:
      • Black (#000000): Sophistication, luxury, technology
      • Gold (#D4AF37): Warm accent, premium quality, memory preservation
      • Cream (#F7F4ED): Softness, olfactive warmth, neutral background
      Secondary Colors (Olfactive Family):
      • Aquatic: Deep Blue (#1E3A5F)
      • Floral: Soft Pink (#F4C2D4)
      • Woody: Warm Brown (#8B5A3C)
      • Gourmand: Caramel (#C88D5C)
      • Green: Fresh Green (#7A9B76)
      • Atmospheric: Misty Gray (#B8B8C8)

      Logo Design

      Primary Logo:

      ```

      ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

      ‚îÇ ‚îÇ

      ‚îÇ M E M O I R ‚îÇ

      ‚îÇ _______________ ‚îÇ (Gold underline)

      ‚îÇ by L'Or√©al Luxe ‚îÇ (Light weight)

      ‚îÇ ‚îÇ

      ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

      ```

      Icon Logo (App/Social):
      • Stylized "M" in gold
      • Circular frame (evokes photo, memory, perfume cap)
      • Minimal, recognizable at small sizes

      Bottle Design

      Shape:
      • Form: Cylindrical column (height 9cm, diameter 3.5cm)
      • Material: Clear flint glass (shows fragrance color)
      • Weight: Substantial (200g total including liquid‚Äîfeels premium)
      Cap:
      • Material: Matte black anodized aluminum
      • Shape: Cylindrical with slight taper
      • Detail: Gold band at base (connects to brand colors)
      • Engraving: "MEMOIR" embossed on top
      Labels: Front Label (Integrated Photo):
      • User's photo printed on high-quality label paper
      • Sealed under clear resin overlay (protection, glossy finish, depth)
      • Photo dimensions: 4cm x 5.5cm (portrait or landscape crop)
      • Gold border frame (2mm) around photo
      • Below photo: Memory title in small gold text ("Maui, June 2024")
      Back Label (Information):

      ```

      MEMOIR by L'Or√©al Luxe

      Eau de Parfum - 30ml / 1.0 fl oz

      "Maui Honeymoon"

      Crafted for [User Name]

      TOP: Bergamot, Coconut Water, Sea Salt

      HEART: Plumeria, Ylang-Ylang, Solar Notes

      BASE: Driftwood, Vanilla, Ambergris

      Perfumer: Sophie Laurent

      Batch No: MEMOIR 03847

      [QR Code]

      Scan to revisit your memory

      Made in France

      ```

      Label Style:
      • Minimalist black text on cream label
      • Small gold accents (note category icons)
      • QR code links to digital memory page (photo gallery, perfumer note, refill ordering)

      Packaging Design

      Outer Box:
      • Dimensions: 12cm x 12cm x 12cm (cube)
      • Material: Premium rigid cardboard (3mm thickness)
      • Finish: Matte black with soft-touch coating
      • Printing: Gold foil "MEMOIR by L'Or√©al Luxe" embossed on top
      • Closure: Magnetic flap (satisfying close, premium feel)
      • Interior: Gold satin lining (luxury reveal)
      Box Interior Layout:

      ```

      ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

      ‚îÇ [Memory Card on top] ‚îÇ (lifted out first)

      ‚îÇ ‚îÇ

      ‚îÇ ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ

      ‚îÇ ‚îÇBottle ‚îÇ ‚îÇSample‚îÇ ‚îÇ (nestled in custom foam)

      ‚îÇ ‚îÇ 30ml ‚îÇ ‚îÇ 2ml ‚îÇ ‚îÇ

      ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îÇ

      ‚îÇ ‚îÇ

      ‚îÇ [Booklet underneath] ‚îÇ

      ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

      ```

      Unboxing Sequence:
      1. Open magnetic box ‚Üí see gold lining
      2. Lift memory card (frameable photo + perfumer note)
      3. See bottle with YOUR photo on it (emotional moment)
      4. Discover sample vial (try-first option)
      5. Find booklet (fragrance story, care instructions)

      App/Website Design

      Design Principles:
      • Visual-First: Large imagery, photo uploads prominent
      • Storytelling: Narrative structure (your memory ‚Üí your fragrance journey)
      • Elegant Minimalism: Black, gold, cream palette; lots of white space
      • Emotional: Soft animations, warm tone, personal language
      Homepage (MEMOIR.com):
      • Hero video (autoplay, no sound): Time-lapse of fragrance creation, user photos fading in/out
      • Headline: "Every Memory Deserves a Scent"
      • CTA: "Create Your MEMOIR" (large gold button)
      • Social proof: "2,847 memories bottled" + customer testimonial carousel
      • "How It Works" (3-step visual)
      • "Explore Memory Gallery" (featured customer stories)
      Upload Page (Creation Flow):
      • Drag-and-drop photo upload (or click to browse)
      • Preview: Photo displays large, centered
      • Context fields: Location, date, memory description (optional)
      • AI preview: "Analyzing your memory..." (loading animation shows visual elements being detected)
      • CTA: "Continue to Perfumer"
      Perfumer Preview Page:
      • Split screen:
      • Left: User's photo
      • Right: Olfactive pyramid (visual graphic of top/heart/base notes)
      • Perfumer bio card: Photo, name, specialization
      • Note descriptions (hover for ingredient details)
      • CTA: "Approve Formula" or "Request Adjustments"
      Mobile App (React Native):
      • Optimized for photo upload (camera integration)
      • Push notifications (production updates, delivery tracking)
      • Memory gallery (save your MEMOIR collection)
      • Reorder/refill (one-tap repeat purchase)
      • Social sharing templates (Instagram story format with #MEMOIRfragrance)

      Social Media Templates

      Instagram Post Template:
      • Square format (1080x1080px)
      • User's photo as background (subtle overlay)
      • Text overlay: "Maui, June 2024 - Now a MEMOIR"
      • Bottle mockup in corner
      • Brand logo + #MEMOIRfragrance
      TikTok Hook Examples:
      • "POV: Your honeymoon photo just became a luxury perfume"
      • "Watch AI turn my favorite memory into a custom fragrance"
      • "Unboxing the most personal gift I've ever received"

      6. BUSINESS MODEL

      Revenue Streams

      PRIMARY: Custom Fragrance Sales

      | Product SKU | Price (‚Ç¨) | COGS (‚Ç¨) | Margin | Target Volume (Year 1) |

      |-------------|-----------|----------|--------|------------------------|

      | MEMOIR Custom (30ml) | ‚Ç¨220 | ‚Ç¨45 | 80% | 20,000 units |

      | Perfumer Consultation Add-On | +‚Ç¨50 | ‚Ç¨5 (15 min video call) | 90% | 4,000 |

      | MEMOIR Gift Set (fragrance + premium packaging + framed photo) | ‚Ç¨280 | ‚Ç¨60 | 79% | 5,000 |

      | Sample Exploration Set (5x2ml samples of popular MEMOIRs) | ‚Ç¨35 | ‚Ç¨10 | 71% | 3,000 |

      Year 1 Revenue (Expert Phase): ‚Ç¨5.2M

      SECONDARY: Refills & Repeat Orders

      | Product SKU | Price (‚Ç¨) | COGS (‚Ç¨) | Margin | Target Volume (Year 2) |

      |-------------|-----------|----------|--------|------------------------|

      | Refill Same Formula (30ml, same bottle style, same photo) | ‚Ç¨120 | ‚Ç¨35 | 71% | 8,000 |

      | Refill + New Bottle (new photo) | ‚Ç¨160 | ‚Ç¨45 | 72% | 3,000 |

      Refill Strategy:
      • Email reminder at 4 months (average usage time)
      • Loyalty discount: 20% off repeat orders
      • Gift refills: "Send your MEMOIR to a friend" (‚Ç¨120, recipient gets full experience)
      Year 2 Refill Revenue: ‚Ç¨1.2M

      TERTIARY: Subscription Model (Launch Year 2)

      | Subscription Tier | Annual Price (‚Ç¨) | Deliverables | Discount vs. √Ä la Carte |

      |-------------------|------------------|--------------|-------------------------|

      | MEMOIR Seasons | ‚Ç¨720/year (‚Ç¨180/quarter) | 4 custom fragrances/year (seasonal memories) | 18% savings |

      | MEMOIR Traveler | ‚Ç¨600/year | 3 custom fragrances + 3 travel-size refills | 15% savings |

      | MEMOIR Collector | ‚Ç¨1,200/year | 6 custom fragrances + early access to limited editions | 20% savings |

      Subscription Benefits:
      • Priority perfumer access
      • Free consultation for each fragrance
      • Exclusive accord library access (subscriber-only notes)
      • Annual gift: Premium refillable bottle (Year 1), leather travel case (Year 2)
      Subscription Adoption Goal: 15% of Year 2 customers (1,500 subscribers) Year 3 Subscription Revenue: ‚Ç¨1.08M

      QUATERNARY: B2B & Partnerships (Year 3+)

      Hotel/Luxury Partnerships:
      • Create signature "place memory" fragrances for luxury hotels
      • Example: "Four Seasons Maui" fragrance (guests can purchase after stay)
      • Revenue share: 50% to MEMOIR, 50% to partner
      • Target: 20 hotel partnerships by Year 3 = ‚Ç¨500K annual revenue
      Corporate Gifting:
      • Custom fragrances for events (weddings, corporate retreats, anniversaries)
      • Bulk pricing: ‚Ç¨180/unit for orders 50+
      • Year 3 target: ‚Ç¨300K from corporate segment
      Licensing:
      • License visual-olfactive database to other fragrance brands (non-luxury)
      • Annual licensing fee: ‚Ç¨500K+ by Year 4

      Unit Economics (Year 1 - Primary Product)

      ```

      Revenue per unit: ‚Ç¨220

      COGS: ‚Ç¨45 (liquid + bottle + packaging + shipping)

      ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ

      Gross Margin: ‚Ç¨175 (80%)

      Variable Costs:

      • AI/Cloud (per unit): ‚Ç¨2 (Google Vision API + hosting)
      • Payment Processing: ‚Ç¨5 (2.5% credit card fees)
      • Customer Service: ‚Ç¨3 (amortized support costs)

      ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ

      Contribution Margin: ‚Ç¨165 (75%)

      Fixed Costs (Amortized):

      • R&D (Year 1): ‚Ç¨2M (database, platform, AI development)
      • Marketing (Year 1): ‚Ç¨1.5M (expert seeding, PR, influencers)
      • Operations (Year 1): ‚Ç¨1M (team salaries, rent, admin)

      ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ

      Total Fixed: ‚Ç¨4.5M

      Break-Even Calculation:

      ‚Ç¨4.5M / ‚Ç¨165 per unit = 27,273 units

      ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ

      Year 1 Target: 20,000 units (‚Ç¨3.3M contribution, -‚Ç¨1.2M loss acceptable for brand building)

      Year 2 Target: 100,000 units (‚Ç¨16.5M contribution, ‚Ç¨11M net profit after fixed costs grow to ‚Ç¨5.5M)

      ```

      Lifetime Value (LTV) Calculation:

      ```

      Average customer lifetime: 4 years

      Purchases per customer:

      • Year 1: 1 initial purchase (‚Ç¨220)
      • Year 2: 1 refill (‚Ç¨120) + 1 new memory (‚Ç¨180)
      • Year 3: Subscription (‚Ç¨720)
      • Year 4: Subscription renewal (‚Ç¨720)

      Total LTV: ‚Ç¨1,960

      Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) Target: ‚Ç¨100 (20:1 LTV:CAC ratio = healthy)

      Payback Period: 4 months (after first refill)

      ```

      Pricing Strategy Justification

      Why ‚Ç¨220? Competitive Positioning:
      • Above mass premium (Chanel ‚Ç¨130, YSL Libre ‚Ç¨135)
      • Below ultra-luxury bespoke (Guerlain ‚Ç¨1,500, Creed custom ‚Ç¨3,000)
      • Comparable to niche customization (Atelier Cologne ‚Ç¨350 but requires in-person)
      Value Perception:
      • Custom = worth 1.5-2x standard luxury fragrance
      • Technology (AI) = premium (justifies higher price than generic niche)
      • Personalization + perfumer artistry = unique value (not just buying scent, buying memory)
      Psychological Pricing:
      • ‚Ç¨220 is "special occasion" price (gift, milestone, treat)
      • Not impulse buy (good‚Äîensures serious customers, reduces returns)
      • Below ‚Ç¨250 threshold (keeps "accessible luxury" positioning)
      Margin Requirements:
      • 80% gross margin funds R&D, marketing, and brand-building
      • Comparable to luxury fragrance industry standard (Chanel, Dior 75-85%)
      • Allows for discount promotions (20% off = ‚Ç¨176, still 70% margin)

      7. GO-TO-MARKET STRATEGY

      Phase 1: Expert Discovery (Year 0-1) | 20,000 Units

      Objective: Build credibility with fragrance experts, establish "hidden treasure" status Target Audience:
      • Fragrance collectors (own 15+ bottles)
      • Niche fragrance enthusiasts (Fragrantica, Basenotes community)
      • Early adopters (tech + luxury intersection)
      • Influencers (micro: 10K-100K followers, high engagement)
      Distribution:
      • 10 flagship locations (invitation-only access):
      • L'Or√©al Luxe boutiques: Paris (Champs-√âlys√©es), NYC (5th Ave), London (Bond St)
      • Select department stores: Harrods (London), Bergdorf Goodman (NYC), Galeries Lafayette (Paris)
      • Exclusive concept stores: Colette successor (Paris), Dover Street Market (multiple cities)
      • Travel retail: Paris CDG, Dubai DXB (high-net-worth travelers)
      • Digital: MEMOIR.com (waitlist only, invite codes required)
      Launch Tactics: Pre-Launch (Months -3 to 0):
      • Seeding: Gift 100 custom MEMOIRs to top fragrance influencers (no obligation to post, but most will)
      • Press Embargo: Exclusive previews to Vogue, GQ, Wallpaper*, Dezeen (technology + luxury angle)
      • Partnership Announcement: PR campaign with Givaudan (credibility: "World's leading fragrance house partners with L'Or√©al on AI innovation")
      Launch Event (Month 0):
      • Venue: L'Or√©al Luxe flagship Paris (invite-only, 200 guests)
      • Experience: Live demo (guest uploads photo on iPad ‚Üí AI analyzes in real-time ‚Üí perfumer explains formula ‚Üí guest receives sample immediately)
      • Speakers: L'Or√©al Luxe CEO, lead perfumer, AI technology partner
      • PR: 50+ press attendees, livestream on Instagram
      Month 1-3:
      • Expert Advocacy: Testimonials from early users featured on website
      • Content Series: "Meet the Perfumers" (YouTube series, behind-the-scenes of formula creation)
      • Community Building: Private Facebook group for MEMOIR creators (share stories, get exclusive updates)
      Month 4-6:
      • Limited Editions: "Seasonal Memory Collection" (curated accords for autumn memories)
      • Collaborations: Partner with luxury travel brands (Aman Resorts, Belmond) for "place memory" experiences
      Month 7-12:
      • Expand Distribution: Add 20 more stores (still selective)
      • Referral Program: Existing customers get ‚Ç¨50 credit for referring friends (word-of-mouth incentive)
      KPIs (Year 1):
      • 20,000 units sold (‚Ç¨4.4M revenue)
      • NPS 90+ (essential for advocacy)
      • 60% referral rate ("Would you recommend MEMOIR?")
      • 100+ press mentions (niche + mainstream media)
      • 50K Instagram followers (organic growth from UGC)

      Phase 2: Expert Endorsement (Year 1-2) | 100,000 Units

      Objective: Validate with experts, prepare for Newcomer scaling Target Audience (Expanding):
      • Maintain Expert segment (depth)
      • Add "Aspirational Experts" (want to be seen as connoisseurs)
      • Begin Newcomer seeding (observe, learn, but don't market directly yet)
      Distribution:
      • 50 locations total (add 40 new stores)
      • Sephora (10 flagship stores only, not all locations)
      • Net-a-Porter, Matches Fashion (online luxury multi-brand)
      • Le Labo-style standalone boutiques (5 cities)
      • Digital: Remove waitlist (open access to MEMOIR.com)
      Marketing: Content Marketing:
      • "Memory Stories" Blog: Customer interviews (deep dives into meaningful memories)
      • Perfumer Journals: Monthly essays from perfumers on craft, inspiration, process
      • Educational Series: "How to Read a Fragrance" (build olfactive literacy)
      Influencer Strategy:
      • Tier 1 (Macro, 500K+): 3-5 partnerships (authentic fragrance enthusiasts only)
      • Tier 2 (Micro, 10K-100K): 50 partnerships (gifted products, organic content)
      • Tier 3 (Nano, 1K-10K): 200 partnerships (affiliate program, 10% commission)
      PR Campaigns:
      • "Fragrance of the Year" Submissions: Apply to awards (Fragrance Foundation, Beauty Oscars)
      • Innovation Showcases: Tech conferences (Web Summit, SXSW) + beauty conferences (in-cosmetics)
      • Sustainability Angle: Highlight refillability, sustainable sourcing (PR to eco-luxury media)
      Year 2 Innovations:
      • Subscription Launch: "MEMOIR Seasons" (quarterly deliveries)
      • App Launch: Mobile app (easier upload, better UX than web)
      • Perfumer Collaboration Series: Limited editions by celebrity perfumers (Dominique Ropion, Olivier Polge)
      KPIs (Year 2):
      • 100,000 units sold (‚Ç¨22M revenue, includes refills)
      • 40% repeat purchase rate (loyalty metric)
      • 200K Instagram followers
      • 15% subscription adoption (15,000 subscribers)
      • Profitability (achieve break-even or small profit)

      Phase 3: Newcomer Discovery (Year 2-3) | 250,000 Units

      Objective: Scale to mass luxury, maintain expert loyalty through tiered offerings Target Audience (Full Dual Target):
      • Experts: Serve with premium tier (MEMOIR Custom + exclusive accords)
      • Newcomers: Serve with accessible tier (MEMOIR Signature - semi-custom from templates)
      Distribution:
      • 300+ locations (add 250 new stores)
      • Sephora (all flagships, 100 stores)
      • Ulta (50 stores, test mass-tige segment)
      • International expansion: Europe (50 stores), Asia (30 stores), Middle East (20 stores)
      • Duty-free (50 locations globally)
      • Digital: 60% of sales (e-commerce scales faster than physical)
      Marketing (Newcomer-Focused): Social Media Blitz:
      • TikTok: Paid ads + organic content (unboxing, creation process, emotional reveals)
      • Instagram: Influencer takeovers, user-generated content campaigns (#MyMEMOIR)
      • Pinterest: Inspiration boards ("Memory Ideas" - travel, weddings, family, etc.)
      Gifting Campaigns:
      • Mother's Day: "Give Mom a fragrance from her favorite memory"
      • Valentine's Day: "The most romantic gift: a fragrance from your first date"
      • Christmas: "Gift them their happiest moment"
      Celebrity/Ambassador Partnerships:
      • 1 global ambassador (A-list, authentic fit): Emma Watson, Timoth√©e Chalamet, Zendaya (someone with nostalgia/memory brand affinity)
      • Campaign: "My MEMOIR" (celebrity shares personal memory fragrance, but focus stays on authenticity‚Äînot endorsement, but genuine use)
      Mass Media:
      • TV Commercials (30 seconds): Emotional storytelling (person uploads photo ‚Üí perfumer crafts ‚Üí emotional unboxing)
      • Print Ads: Vogue, GQ, Kinfolk (visual-first, photo on bottle prominent)
      • Out-of-Home: Transit ads in NYC, London, Paris (aspirational luxury placement)
      Tiered Product Strategy (Maintain Expert Appeal):

      | Tier | Product | Price | Target | Positioning |

      |------|---------|-------|--------|-------------|

      | Ultra-Premium | MEMOIR Custom | ‚Ç¨220 | Experts | Full personalization, perfumer consultation, exclusive accords |

      | Premium | MEMOIR Signature | ‚Ç¨150 | Newcomers | Semi-custom (choose memory category + adjust intensity), faster turnaround |

      | Accessible | MEMOIR Discovery Set | ‚Ç¨75 | Entry-level | 5 popular MEMOIRs (2ml each), gateway product |

      Newcomer Product (MEMOIR Signature) Details:
      • User selects from 10 memory templates:
      • Beach Paradise, Mountain Retreat, Urban Romance, Garden Serenity, Childhood Kitchen, Forest Adventure, Celebration, Tropical Escape, Cozy Home, Seasonal Memory
      • Uploads photo (for bottle label only, not full AI analysis)
      • Adjusts 3 sliders: Intensity (light/medium/strong), Sweetness (fresh/balanced/gourmand), Character (floral/woody/aquatic)
      • Pre-made formula based on selections (not custom from scratch)
      • 1-week turnaround (faster than Custom)
      • Price: ‚Ç¨150 (more accessible than ‚Ç¨220, still premium)
      Result: Experts keep buying Custom (exclusive, truly unique), Newcomers buy Signature (accessible, still personal) KPIs (Year 3):
      • 250,000 units sold (‚Ç¨50M revenue across all SKUs)
      • 300K Instagram followers, #MEMOIRfragrance 50M views
      • 50% of sales are gifts (validates gift market hypothesis)
      • Subscription: 25,000 subscribers (‚Ç¨18M annual recurring revenue)
      • International: 40% of sales outside home market

      Phase 4: Icon Status (Year 4-5) | 500,000+ Units

      Objective: Establish MEMOIR as top-5 Exception fragrance globally, prepare for evolution (MEMOIR CHEMISTRY) Distribution:
      • 500+ locations globally
      • E-commerce: 70% of sales (personalization inherently digital)
      • Brand boutiques: 10 standalone MEMOIR stores (NYC, Paris, London, Tokyo, Shanghai, Dubai, LA, Milan, Hong Kong, Singapore)
      Marketing (Maturity):
      • Brand Campaigns: Shift from product features to brand values ("Memories matter," "Your story is your signature")
      • Cultural Positioning: MEMOIR as lifestyle brand (not just fragrance‚Äîmemory preservation movement)
      • Collaborations: Fashion (MEMOIR x Jacquemus - summer memories collection), art (MEMOIR x museum exhibitions)
      Innovation (Re-Enchantment):
      • MEMOIR CHEMISTRY Launch (Year 4):
      • Add genetic compatibility layer (as predicted in strategy)
      • Position as "MEMOIR 2.0" (evolution, not replacement)
      • Premium tier: ‚Ç¨350 for biology + memory dual-layer fragrance
      • PR angle: "World's first fragrance optimized for your DNA AND your story"
      KPIs (Year 5):
      • 500,000-750,000 units sold annually (‚Ç¨100-150M revenue)
      • Top 5 Exception fragrance brand globally (by revenue)
      • Brand valuation: ‚Ç¨300-500M (acquisition target or standalone IPO-ready)
      • "Memory fragrance" = established category, MEMOIR is #1

      | Year 2 (Expert Endorsement) | 100,000 | ‚Ç¨220 | ‚Ç¨22M | ‚Ç¨4.5M | ‚Ç¨17.5M | ‚Ç¨7M | ‚Ç¨10.5M | 48% |

      | Year 3 (Newcomer Discovery) | 250,000 | ‚Ç¨200* | ‚Ç¨50M | ‚Ç¨11M | ‚Ç¨39M | ‚Ç¨12M | ‚Ç¨27M | 54% |

      | Year 4 (Scaling) | 450,000 | ‚Ç¨190* | ‚Ç¨85.5M | ‚Ç¨19.5M | ‚Ç¨66M | ‚Ç¨18M | ‚Ç¨48M | 56% |

      | Year 5 (Icon Status) | 700,000 | ‚Ç¨185* | ‚Ç¨130M | ‚Ç¨30M | ‚Ç¨100M | ‚Ç¨25M | ‚Ç¨75M | 58% |

      Notes:
      • *Average price decreases as product mix shifts (more MEMOIR Signature at ‚Ç¨150, refills at ‚Ç¨120)
      • COGS as percentage of revenue: ~22% (includes economies of scale by Year 3)
      • Fixed costs grow with scale (team expansion, R&D for MEMOIR CHEMISTRY, international ops)
      • Cumulative 5-year profit: ‚Ç¨159.5M
      • Return on initial investment (‚Ç¨5.5M total over Years 1-2): 29x by Year 5

      | R&D | ‚Ç¨2.5M | Visual-olfactive database (perfumer interviews, ML training), platform development (web/app), AI integration, accord library creation (50 initial accords) |

      | Operations | ‚Ç¨1M | Team salaries (5 FTEs: CTO, Head of Perfumery, Product Manager, 2 Engineers), office setup, legal, IP protection (patents) |

      | Marketing | ‚Ç¨1.5M | Expert seeding (100 influencer gifts), launch event, PR agency, content creation, website, social media ads |

      | Inventory | ‚Ç¨0.5M | Initial production run (3,000 units, enough for 6 months at projected pace), packaging materials, accord library ingredients |

      Series A (Year 2): ‚Ç¨10M (if needed for aggressive scaling) Use of Funds:
      • International expansion (‚Ç¨3M)
      • Team growth: 20 FTEs (‚Ç¨2M annual)
      • Marketing scale (‚Ç¨3M - influencer campaigns, paid media)
      • Tech infrastructure (‚Ç¨1M - mobile app, production automation)
      • Inventory (‚Ç¨1M - grow to 10,000 unit buffer)
      Alternative: Profitable Growth (No Series A)
      • Year 2 generates ‚Ç¨10.5M profit ‚Üí reinvest internally
      • Slower growth but maintain equity (no dilution)
      • Recommended path if Year 1 meets targets (de-risked)

      Break-Even Analysis

      Fixed Costs (Ongoing):
      • R&D: ‚Ç¨500K/year (continuous database expansion, AI improvement)
      • Salaries: ‚Ç¨1.5M/year (Year 1: 5 FTEs; Year 3: 15 FTEs; Year 5: 30 FTEs)
      • Marketing: ‚Ç¨1M/year (Year 1); scales to ‚Ç¨5M/year by Year 3
      • Operations: ‚Ç¨500K/year (office, software, admin)
      Total Fixed (Year 1): ‚Ç¨4.5M Contribution Margin per Unit: ‚Ç¨165 (revenue ‚Ç¨220 - variable costs ‚Ç¨55) Break-Even Units (Year 1): ‚Ç¨4.5M / ‚Ç¨165 = 27,273 units Target Units (Year 1): 20,000 (intentionally below break-even for brand-building phase) Break-Even Timeline: Month 8 of Year 2 (cumulative profitable after recouping Year 1 loss)

      9. COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE

      Undupability Scorecard (vs. Potential Competitors)

      | Barrier | MEMOIR Strength | Dupe Difficulty | Time to Replicate |

      |---------|-----------------|-----------------|-------------------|

      | Proprietary Database | 500+ visual-olfactive mappings (perfumer-validated) | VERY HARD | 18-24 months + ‚Ç¨2M |

      | Perfumer Network | Exclusive L'Or√©al partnerships, trained on system | HARD | 12+ months (recruit + train) |

      | Accord Library | 100 exclusive L'Or√©al formulations (Osmobloom‚Ñ¢) | HARD | 12-18 months + access to materials |

      | AI Algorithm | Custom ML model (trained on proprietary data) | MEDIUM | 6-12 months (but needs database) |

      | Brand Heritage | 120 years L'Or√©al fragrance expertise + legitimacy | IMPOSSIBLE | Cannot replicate |

      | First-Mover | Category ownership ("memory fragrance = MEMOIR") | MEDIUM | Brand association takes 3-5 years |

      | Digital Ecosystem | App, community, subscription lock-in | MEDIUM | 6-12 months (but needs users) |

      | Patents | Visual-olfactive mapping methodology (patent pending) | HARD | Legal protection (20 years) |

      Overall Undupability: 8.5/10 (Very Strong) Vulnerable Points:
      • Tech startups could build similar AI system (but lack perfumer credibility)
      • Niche fragrance houses have perfumer access (but lack tech/scale capabilities)
      • LVMH/Est√©e Lauder could enter (biggest threat, but need 2+ years to catch up)
      Defense Strategy:
      • Move fast: Establish brand before competitors wake up (18-24 month window)
      • Continuous innovation: MEMOIR CHEMISTRY (Year 4) stays ahead of copycats
      • Ecosystem lock-in: Subscription + community = switching costs
      • IP protection: File patents immediately (visual-olfactive mapping process)

      MEMOIR's Sweet Spot:
      • High personalization (truly custom formula from YOUR memory)
      • High tech (AI-powered, scalable)
      • Luxury quality (perfumer oversight, premium materials)
      • Accessible pricing (‚Ç¨220 vs. ‚Ç¨3K traditional bespoke)
      White Space: No competitor occupies this quadrant (high-tech + high-personalization + luxury + scalable)

      10. IMPLEMENTATION ROADMAP

      18-Month Timeline to Launch

      PHASE 0: Foundation (Months 1-6) | PRE-LAUNCH

      Month 1-2: Team & Partnerships
      • ‚úÖ Hire core team: CTO, Head of Perfumery, Product Manager, 2 AI Engineers
      • ‚úÖ Sign fragrance house partnership (Givaudan or IFF)
      • ‚úÖ Contract 3 master perfumers (exclusive arrangement)
      • ‚úÖ Secure Google Cloud Vision API partnership
      Month 2-4: Database Development
      • ‚úÖ Conduct perfumer interviews (100 hours, 10 perfumers)
      • ‚úÖ Create initial 200 visual-olfactive mappings
      • ‚úÖ Build database infrastructure (PostgreSQL + API)
      • ‚úÖ Validate mappings with test images (100 diverse photos)
      Month 3-6: Accord Library Creation
      • ‚úÖ Formulate 50 initial "memory accords" with perfumers
      • ‚úÖ Test accord combinations (ensure compatibility)
      • ‚úÖ Create production specs (for manufacturing partner)
      • ‚úÖ Quality control: Perfumers approve all accords
      Month 4-6: Platform Development (MVP)
      • ‚úÖ Build web app (React): Upload, preview, order flow
      • ‚úÖ Integrate Google Vision API (image analysis)
      • ‚úÖ Build AI formula generation engine (v1.0)
      • ‚úÖ Create perfumer dashboard (review/edit interface)
      • ‚úÖ Test end-to-end flow (internal team uses system)

      PHASE 1: Alpha Testing (Months 7-9) | PRIVATE BETA

      Month 7-8: Internal Alpha
      • ‚úÖ 20 internal testers (L'Or√©al employees) create MEMOIRs
      • ‚úÖ Collect feedback: UX issues, AI accuracy, fragrance quality
      • ‚úÖ Iterate: Fix bugs, refine AI, adjust accords
      • ‚úÖ Perfumer calibration: Ensure consistency across perfumers
      Month 9: Friends & Family Beta
      • ‚úÖ 100 external beta testers (invite-only)
      • ‚úÖ Track metrics: NPS, fragrance satisfaction, AI accuracy
      • ‚úÖ Collect testimonials (use for marketing)
      • ‚úÖ Refine: Database expansion (add 50 more mappings), UX improvements
      Deliverables by Month 9:
      • ‚úÖ Working platform (web app)
      • ‚úÖ 250 visual-olfactive mappings (80% coverage)
      • ‚úÖ 50 accord library (production-ready)
      • ‚úÖ 120 MEMOIRs created (proof of concept)
      • ‚úÖ 90+ NPS from beta testers

      PHASE 2: Pre-Launch (Months 10-12) | BRAND BUILDING

      Month 10: Brand Identity Finalization
      • ‚úÖ Design: Logo, packaging, bottle, labels (final approval)
      • ‚úÖ Photography: Product shots, lifestyle imagery
      • ‚úÖ Website: Full e-commerce site (not just MVP)
      • ‚úÖ Social media: Set up accounts, pre-launch teasers
      Month 11: Influencer Seeding
      • ‚úÖ Identify 100 top fragrance influencers (micro to macro)
      • ‚úÖ Gift custom MEMOIRs (no obligation, but most will post)
      • ‚úÖ Track: Engagement, reach, sentiment
      Month 12: PR & Media
      • ‚úÖ Press releases: "World's First AI-Powered Memory Fragrance"
      • ‚úÖ Media preview: Invite Vogue, GQ, Wallpaper*, etc. for demos
      • ‚úÖ Launch event planning (Month 13 event)
      Month 10-12: Operations Setup
      • ‚úÖ Production: First 3,000 unit run (‚Ç¨135K investment)
      • ‚úÖ Inventory: Store 3,000 bottles, packaging materials
      • ‚úÖ Logistics: Shipping partners, fulfillment setup
      • ‚úÖ Customer service: Hire 2 CS reps, create FAQ/support docs

      PHASE 3: Public Launch (Month 13) | EXPERT DISCOVERY BEGINS

      Month 13: Launch Event & Website Go-Live
      • üöÄ Launch Event: Paris flagship boutique (200 guests, press, influencers)
      • üöÄ Website: MEMOIR.com live (invite-only at first)
      • üöÄ PR Blitz: 50+ articles in fragrance, tech, luxury press
      • üöÄ Social Media: Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, Pinterest go live
      Month 13-15: Expert Phase Ramp-Up
      • üìà Target: 1,500 units/month (5,000 in first 3 months)
      • üìà Distribution: 10 exclusive locations + online
      • üìà Marketing: Influencer posts, organic UGC, PR follow-up
      Month 16-18: Expert Phase Maturity
      • üìà Target: 2,000 units/month (6,000 in months 16-18)
      • üìà Expand: Add 10 more stores (20 total)
      • üìà Refine: Improve AI (learn from perfumer edits), expand database (add 50 mappings)
      • üìà Prepare: Year 2 Newcomer expansion planning
      Month 18 Milestone:
      • ‚úÖ 20,000 units sold (Year 1 target achieved)
      • ‚úÖ ‚Ç¨4.4M revenue
      • ‚úÖ 90+ NPS (expert satisfaction)
      • ‚úÖ 50K Instagram followers (organic + influencer-driven)
      • ‚úÖ Break-even timeline confirmed (Month 24-26)

      CONCLUSION: WHY MEMOIR WINS

      The Winning Formula

      MEMOIR succeeds because it combines 4 unprecedented elements:
      1. Emotional Resonance: Memories are universal, deeply personal, and infinitely meaningful (everyone has a story to bottle)
      1. Technical Innovation: AI-powered visual-to-olfactive translation is first-of-its-kind, defensible, and credible
      1. Artistic Excellence: Master perfumer oversight ensures luxury quality (not algorithmic mediocrity)
      1. Business Model: Scalable bespoke (mass personalization) at luxury margins (80% gross) with recurring revenue (subscription)

      The L'Or√©al Advantage

      Why L'Or√©al is uniquely positioned to win with MEMOIR:
      • ‚úÖ Heritage: 120 years of fragrance expertise (Lanc√¥me, YSL, Armani) = consumer trust
      • ‚úÖ Technology: Proven beauty tech capabilities (ModiFace, Scent-Sation, Perso) = feasibility credibility
      • ‚úÖ Partnerships: Exclusive relationships with master perfumers + fragrance houses = quality assurance
      • ‚úÖ Distribution: Global retail network (Sephora, flagships, duty-free) = scale capability
      • ‚úÖ Capital: Resources to invest ‚Ç¨5.5M in R&D without blinking = execution ability
      Competitors cannot replicate this combination:
      • Tech startups: Have AI, lack perfumer credibility + distribution
      • Niche brands: Have perfumers, lack tech + scale
      • LVMH/Est√©e Lauder: Have resources, but need 2 years to catch up (first-mover advantage)

      The Path to ‚Ç¨150M

      Year 1: Validate with Experts (20K units, ‚Ç¨4.4M, NPS 90+) Year 2: Prove repeatability (100K units, ‚Ç¨22M, profitable) Year 3: Scale to Newcomers (250K units, ‚Ç¨50M, dual-target success) Year 4: Innovate (MEMOIR CHEMISTRY, stay ahead of dupes) Year 5: Dominate (700K units, ‚Ç¨150M, category leadership) Total Addressable Market: ‚Ç¨3-4B (personalized luxury fragrance segment) MEMOIR's Year 5 Share: 5% of TAM (‚Ç¨150M / ‚Ç¨3B = achievable icon status)

      Document Status: Concept blueprint complete Next Action: Begin visual identity design + AI prototype development Confidence Level: VERY HIGH ‚úÖ

      AI VISUAL-TO-OLFACTIVE MAPPING PROTOTYPE

      MEMOIR Technology Demonstration - 50 Core Mappings

      Document Version: 1.0 Purpose: Proof-of-concept demonstration of proprietary visual-to-olfactive translation algorithm Status: Prototype v1.0 (50 mappings, expandable to 500+) For: L'Or√©al Brandstorm 2026 Jury Presentation

      EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

      This document demonstrates MEMOIR's core innovation: the world's first systematic, AI-powered translation from visual imagery to olfactive formulation.

      The Challenge: How do you turn a photograph‚Äîpurely visual information‚Äîinto a fragrance formula? The Solution: Proprietary visual-olfactive database trained through:
      • 100+ hours of master perfumer interviews
      • Computer vision AI (object detection, scene classification, color analysis)
      • Weighted relevance scoring (statistical validation)
      • Continuous machine learning (improves with every fragrance created)
      This Prototype:
      • 50 core visual elements mapped to 75 olfactive notes
      • Covers 80% of common memory types (travel, family, nature, food, celebrations)
      • Demonstrates technical feasibility for Brandstorm timeline
      • Roadmap to 500+ mappings by Year 2

      TABLE OF CONTENTS

      1. [How the System Works](#how-the-system-works)
      2. [The 50 Core Visual Elements](#the-50-core-visual-elements)
      3. [The 75 Olfactive Notes Library](#the-75-olfactive-notes-library)
      4. [Complete Mapping Database](#complete-mapping-database)
      5. [Example Translations (10 Real-World Scenarios)](#example-translations)
      6. [Technical Architecture](#technical-architecture)
      7. [Validation Methodology](#validation-methodology)
      8. [Future Roadmap](#future-roadmap)

      1. HOW THE SYSTEM WORKS

      Step-by-Step Process

      ```

      USER PHOTO

      ‚îÇ

      ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ> STEP 1: Computer Vision Analysis (Google Cloud Vision API)

      ‚îÇ ‚Üì

      ‚îÇ Detects: Objects, Scenes, Colors, Mood

      ‚îÇ Output: ["beach", "ocean", "palm_tree", "sunset", "tropical"]

      ‚îÇ

      ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ> STEP 2: Visual-Olfactive Database Lookup

      ‚îÇ ‚Üì

      ‚îÇ Queries: "beach" ‚Üí [salt_accord, driftwood, coconut, etc.]

      ‚îÇ Scores: Relevance weights (0.0 to 1.0)

      ‚îÇ Output: List of candidate olfactive notes with scores

      ‚îÇ

      ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ> STEP 3: User Context Integration

      ‚îÇ ‚Üì

      ‚îÇ Input: "I remember plumeria flowers and coconut sunscreen"

      ‚îÇ Boost: Plumeria score +0.3, Coconut score +0.2

      ‚îÇ Output: Adjusted candidate note list

      ‚îÇ

      ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ> STEP 4: Formula Generation Algorithm

      ‚îÇ ‚Üì

      ‚îÇ Selects: Top 8-12 notes (balance top/heart/base)

      ‚îÇ Structures: Note pyramid (proportions for each note)

      ‚îÇ Validates: Compatibility (avoid clashing combinations)

      ‚îÇ Output: Preliminary fragrance formula (JSON)

      ‚îÇ

      ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ> STEP 5: Perfumer Review & Adjustment

      ‚Üì

      Human expertise: Refines proportions, swaps notes, approves

      Output: Final fragrance formula ‚Üí Production

      ```

      Key Innovation: Weighted Relevance Scoring

      Example: "Beach" Visual Element

      | Olfactive Note | Relevance Score | Source | Confidence |

      |----------------|-----------------|--------|------------|

      | Salt accord | 0.92 | 9/10 perfumers mentioned | Very High |

      | Coconut | 0.85 | 8/10 perfumers, common association | High |

      | Ambergris | 0.88 | Traditional beach note, oceanic | High |

      | Seaweed | 0.75 | 7/10 perfumers, less common | Medium-High |

      | Driftwood | 0.78 | Contextual, weathered wood | Medium-High |

      | Sunscreen (synthetic) | 0.65 | Modern association, divisive | Medium |

      | Sand (mineral) | 0.70 | Dry, chalky, niche interpretation | Medium |

      How Scores Are Used:
      • Algorithm selects notes with scores ‚â•0.70 (threshold for quality)
      • User mentions boost score by +0.20 ("I remember coconut sunscreen" ‚Üí Coconut jumps to 1.05, capped at 1.0)
      • Negative context lowers score ("Not too sweet" ‚Üí Coconut -0.10 to 0.75)

      2. THE 50 CORE VISUAL ELEMENTS

      Category A: AQUATIC & WATER (10 Elements)

      | Visual Element | AI Detection Label | Associated Sensory Qualities |

      |----------------|--------------------|------------------------------|

      | Ocean | "ocean", "sea", "water", "waves" | Salt, mineral, vast, fresh |

      | Beach | "beach", "sand", "shore", "coast" | Warm sand, mineral, sun-baked |

      | Lake | "lake", "calm_water", "freshwater" | Fresh, clean, cool, mineral |

      | River | "river", "stream", "flowing_water" | Moving water, rocks, cool |

      | Rain | "rain", "storm", "wet", "droplets" | Petrichor, wet earth, ozone |

      | Waterfall | "waterfall", "cascade", "mist" | Rushing water, mist, moss |

      | Swimming Pool | "pool", "chlorinated_water" | Chlorine, clean water, summer |

      | Snow | "snow", "winter", "ice", "frost" | Cold, clean, crisp, white musk |

      | Fog/Mist | "fog", "mist", "haze" | Damp, cool, atmospheric |

      | Tide Pool | "tidepool", "rocky_shore" | Seaweed, iodine, marine life |

      Category B: FLORAL & BOTANICAL (10 Elements)

      | Visual Element | AI Detection Label | Associated Sensory Qualities |

      |----------------|--------------------|------------------------------|

      | Rose | "rose", "red_flower", "rose_bush" | Classic floral, romantic, velvety |

      | Tropical Flowers | "plumeria", "frangipani", "hibiscus" | Exotic, creamy, sweet, tropical |

      | Lavender | "lavender", "purple_field", "provence" | Herbal, aromatic, calming |

      | Jasmine | "jasmine", "white_flower", "night_blooming" | Heady, intoxicating, sweet |

      | Wildflowers | "wildflowers", "meadow", "field_flowers" | Mixed floral, fresh, meadowy |

      | Cherry Blossom | "cherry_blossom", "sakura", "pink_petals" | Delicate, soft, powdery, spring |

      | Lily | "lily", "calla_lily", "white_lily" | Fresh floral, green, aquatic |

      | Orchid | "orchid", "exotic_flower" | Sophisticated, rare, elegant |

      | Sunflower | "sunflower", "yellow_flower" | Warm, nutty, sunny, cheerful |

      | Garden | "garden", "botanical_garden", "flowerbeds" | Mixed floral, green, earthy |

      Category C: WOODY & FOREST (8 Elements)

      | Visual Element | AI Detection Label | Associated Sensory Qualities |

      |----------------|--------------------|------------------------------|

      | Forest | "forest", "woods", "trees" | Pine, moss, damp earth, green |

      | Pine Trees | "pine", "conifer", "evergreen" | Resinous, fresh, sharp, green |

      | Autumn Leaves | "autumn", "fall_leaves", "foliage" | Dry leaves, earthy, cozy |

      | Tree Bark | "tree_bark", "wood_texture" | Woody, dry, textured |

      | Cabin | "cabin", "wooden_house", "log_cabin" | Wood smoke, cedar, cozy |

      | Campfire | "campfire", "fire", "bonfire" | Smoke, burning wood, charred |

      | Driftwood | "driftwood", "beach_wood" | Weathered wood, salt, sun-bleached |

      | Bamboo | "bamboo", "asian_garden" | Green, fresh, zen, light woody |

      Category D: GOURMAND & FOOD (8 Elements)

      | Visual Element | AI Detection Label | Associated Sensory Qualities |

      |----------------|--------------------|------------------------------|

      | Bakery | "bakery", "bread", "pastries" | Fresh bread, yeast, butter, warm |

      | Coffee Shop | "coffee", "cafe", "espresso_machine" | Roasted coffee, milk, wood |

      | Vanilla | "vanilla_beans", "vanilla_extract" | Sweet, creamy, warm, comforting |

      | Chocolate | "chocolate", "cacao", "cocoa" | Rich, dark, sweet, indulgent |

      | Cinnamon Roll | "cinnamon_rolls", "pastry" | Cinnamon, sugar, yeast, butter |

      | Coconut | "coconut", "coconut_palm" | Tropical, creamy, sweet, milky |

      | Citrus | "lemon", "orange", "citrus_fruit" | Bright, zesty, fresh, tangy |

      | Honey | "honey", "honeycomb", "beehive" | Sweet, floral, waxy, golden |

      Category E: EARTHY & MINERAL (6 Elements)

      | Visual Element | AI Detection Label | Associated Sensory Qualities |

      |----------------|--------------------|------------------------------|

      | Soil | "soil", "dirt", "earth" | Damp earth, organic, grounding |

      | Petrichor | "rain_on_earth", "wet_soil", "first_rain" | Geosmin, fresh rain on dry earth |

      | Stone/Rock | "stone", "rock", "granite", "mountain" | Mineral, cold, hard, clean |

      | Desert | "desert", "sand_dunes", "arid" | Dry sand, heat, mineral, sparse |

      | Clay | "clay", "pottery", "terracotta" | Wet clay, earthy, ceramic |

      | Cave | "cave", "cavern", "underground" | Damp rock, cool, mineral, dark |

      Category F: GREEN & HERBAL (4 Elements)

      | Visual Element | AI Detection Label | Associated Sensory Qualities |

      |----------------|--------------------|------------------------------|

      | Grass | "grass", "lawn", "green_field" | Fresh-cut grass, chlorophyll, green |

      | Herbs | "basil", "mint", "herbs", "herb_garden" | Aromatic, fresh, culinary |

      | Fern | "fern", "forest_floor" | Green, damp, shaded, earthy |

      | Tea | "tea", "tea_leaves", "tea_ceremony" | Vegetal, green, delicate |

      Category D: ATMOSPHERIC & AMBIENT (4 Elements)

      | Visual Element | AI Detection Label | Associated Sensory Qualities |

      |----------------|--------------------|------------------------------|

      | Sunset | "sunset", "golden_hour", "dusk" | Warm, amber, glowing, golden |

      | Sunrise | "sunrise", "dawn", "morning" | Fresh, bright, clean, hopeful |

      | Twilight | "twilight", "dusk", "evening" | Cool, mysterious, transition |

      | Storm | "storm", "thunderstorm", "lightning" | Ozone, electricity, rain, intensity |

      3. THE 75 OLFACTIVE NOTES LIBRARY

      Fragrance Note Types

      TOP NOTES (Volatile, 5-15 min longevity)
      • Citrus, light florals, green, aquatic, aldehydic
      HEART NOTES (Medium volatility, 30-120 min)
      • Florals, spices, fruits, aromatic herbs
      BASE NOTES (Low volatility, 3-8 hours)
      • Woods, musks, ambers, vanillas, resins

      The 75 Core Notes

      AQUATIC FAMILY (10 Notes)

      | Note ID | Note Name | Note Type | Character Description |

      |---------|-----------|-----------|----------------------|

      | A01 | Salt Accord | Top | Mineral, oceanic, fresh, briny |

      | A02 | Ambergris Accord | Base | Oceanic, warm, musky, animalic |

      | A03 | Seaweed | Heart | Marine, green, iodine, aquatic |

      | A04 | Ozone | Top | Clean, fresh air, electric, crisp |

      | A05 | Aquatic Notes | Heart | Water-like, transparent, modern |

      | A06 | Coconut Water | Top/Heart | Fresh coconut, not sweet, watery |

      | A07 | Mineral Accord | Base | Stones, wet rock, clean mineral |

      | A08 | Sea Foam | Top | Frothy, airy, salty, light |

      | A09 | Rain Accord | Top | Wet, fresh, petrichor, clean |

      | A10 | Ice/Snow Accord | Top | Cold, white musk, clean, crisp |

      FLORAL FAMILY (15 Notes)

      | Note ID | Note Name | Note Type | Character Description |

      |---------|-----------|-----------|----------------------|

      | F01 | Rose Absolute | Heart | Classic rose, velvety, rich |

      | F02 | Plumeria Absolute | Heart | Tropical, creamy, exotic white floral |

      | F03 | Jasmine Sambac | Heart | Heady, intoxicating, night-blooming |

      | F04 | Lavender | Top/Heart | Herbal, aromatic, calming, purple |

      | F05 | Ylang-Ylang | Heart | Creamy, tropical, slightly sweet |

      | F06 | Orange Blossom (Neroli) | Top | Citrus floral, bright, wedding-like |

      | F07 | Lily of the Valley | Heart | Fresh, green, delicate, spring |

      | F08 | Iris | Heart/Base | Powdery, elegant, sophisticated |

      | F09 | Magnolia | Heart | Creamy, soft, southern, elegant |

      | F10 | Cherry Blossom Accord | Heart | Soft pink floral, powdery, spring |

      | F11 | Tuberose | Heart | Heady, narcotic, creamy, bold |

      | F12 | Peony | Heart | Soft, fresh, romantic, light |

      | F13 | Gardenia | Heart | Creamy, lush, intoxicating |

      | F14 | Violet | Heart | Powdery, soft, nostalgic, candy-like |

      | F15 | Orchid Accord | Heart | Exotic, rare, sophisticated, elegant |

      WOODY FAMILY (12 Notes)

      | Note ID | Note Name | Note Type | Character Description |

      |---------|-----------|-----------|----------------------|

      | W01 | Cedarwood | Base | Dry, pencil shavings, aromatic |

      | W02 | Sandalwood | Base | Creamy, warm, milky, smooth |

      | W03 | Pine | Top/Heart | Resinous, sharp, forest, evergreen |

      | W04 | Driftwood | Base | Weathered, soft, salt-aged, sun-bleached |

      | W05 | Guaiac Wood | Base | Smoky, earthy, medicinal, deep |

      | W06 | Oak | Base | Rich, aged, barrel-like, robust |

      | W07 | Bamboo | Top/Heart | Green, fresh, light woody, zen |

      | W08 | Birch | Base | Smoky, tarry, leathery, cold |

      | W09 | Cypress | Base | Dry, aromatic, Mediterranean, resinous |

      | W10 | Palo Santo | Heart/Base | Sacred, sweet smoke, aromatic |

      | W11 | Mahogany | Base | Rich, red, polished, luxurious |

      | W12 | Agarwood (Oud) | Base | Resinous, animalic, complex, precious |

      GOURMAND FAMILY (12 Notes)

      | Note ID | Note Name | Note Type | Character Description |

      |---------|-----------|-----------|----------------------|

      | G01 | Vanilla | Base | Sweet, creamy, warm, comforting |

      | G02 | Coffee | Heart | Roasted, bitter, aromatic, energizing |

      | G03 | Cinnamon | Heart | Spicy, warm, sweet, bakery |

      | G04 | Chocolate | Base | Rich, dark, cocoa, indulgent |

      | G05 | Caramel | Base | Burnt sugar, buttery, sweet |

      | G06 | Honey | Heart/Base | Sweet, floral, waxy, golden |

      | G07 | Almond | Heart | Marzipan, nutty, sweet, milky |

      | G08 | Coconut Milk | Heart/Base | Creamy, tropical, sweet, rich |

      | G09 | Tonka Bean | Base | Vanilla-like, hay-like, sweet, warm |

      | G10 | Praline | Base | Nutty, caramelized, sweet, rich |

      | G11 | Rum | Heart | Dark, spicy, boozy, molasses |

      | G12 | Butter | Heart | Creamy, rich, bakery, warm |

      GREEN & HERBAL FAMILY (8 Notes)

      | Note ID | Note Name | Note Type | Character Description |

      |---------|-----------|-----------|----------------------|

      | H01 | Fresh-Cut Grass | Top | Green, chlorophyll, fresh, lawn |

      | H02 | Basil | Top | Herbal, bright, culinary, anise-like |

      | H03 | Mint | Top | Cool, fresh, aromatic, sharp |

      | H04 | Green Tea | Top/Heart | Vegetal, fresh, clean, Japanese |

      | H05 | Fern | Heart | Green, damp, shaded, earthy |

      | H06 | Tomato Leaf | Top | Green, vegetal, tangy, garden |

      | H07 | Cucumber | Top | Fresh, watery, cool, clean |

      | H08 | Sage | Top/Heart | Herbal, aromatic, savory, dry |

      EARTHY & RESINOUS FAMILY (10 Notes)

      | Note ID | Note Name | Note Type | Character Description |

      |---------|-----------|-----------|----------------------|

      | E01 | Vetiver | Base | Earthy, woody, rooty, grounding |

      | E02 | Patchouli | Base | Earthy, dark, hippie, aged-wine-like |

      | E03 | Oakmoss | Base | Earthy, damp, forest floor, chypre |

      | E04 | Petrichor | Top/Heart | Rain on dry earth, geosmin, nostalgic |

      | E05 | Wet Soil | Base | Damp earth, organic, humid |

      | E06 | Mushroom | Heart | Fungal, damp leaves, umami, forest |

      | E07 | Frankincense | Base | Resinous, sacred, incense, meditative |

      | E08 | Myrrh | Base | Resinous, balsamic, warm, ancient |

      | E09 | Benzoin | Base | Vanilla-resinous, sweet, comforting |

      | E10 | Labdanum | Base | Amber-like, leathery, animalic, warm |

      MUSK & AMBER FAMILY (8 Notes)

      | Note ID | Note Name | Note Type | Character Description |

      |---------|-----------|-----------|----------------------|

      | M01 | White Musk | Base | Clean, soft, skin-like, modern |

      | M02 | Skin Musk | Base | Intimate, warm, human skin, sensual |

      | M03 | Amber | Base | Warm, golden, resinous, glowing |

      | M04 | Solar Notes | Heart/Base | Sun-warmed skin, heliotrope, radiant |

      | M05 | Cashmeran | Base | Soft, musky, woody, velvety |

      | M06 | Iso E Super | Base | Woody, transparent, skin-scent, modern |

      | M07 | Animalic Musk | Base | Sensual, primal, intimate, bold |

      | M08 | Clean Musk | Base | Fresh laundry, soap, white, modern |
